The F82 is the first BMW M4 and the successor to the E92 generation of the M3 coupe. The M4 cuts weight by incorporating carbon fiber, while delivering exciting performance from a twin-turbo straight-6 engine shared with the F80 M3 sedan. 2020 was the last year of production before the controversial grille change.

BMW produced 750 M Heritage Edition M4 Coupes to bid farewell to the first-generation M4. Available in three colors paying homage to the original M colors of blue, violet, and red, each M Heritage Edition model is equipped with the Competition Package, a carbon fiber roof with M stripes added below the clear coat, and exclusive M-colored carbon fiber interior trim.
Power comes from a 3.0-liter turbocharged inline-6 engine, rated at 444 horsepower and 406 lb-ft of torque. Output is sent to the rear wheels via a 7-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission.
